message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with a decision-making problem in a Markov chain observed in noise, which is a common topic in machine learning and artificial intelligence. The formulation of the problem as a Partially Observed Markov Decision Process (POMDP) suggests that it belongs to the sub-category of cs.AI. The use of structural results and threshold curves to characterize the optimal multiple stopping policy is a common approach in optimization and control theory, which suggests that it also belongs to the sub-category of cs.DS. The application of the framework to interactive advertising in social media suggests that it belongs to the sub-category of cs.SI. Finally, the use of copositive ordering and stochastic gradient algorithms suggests that it also belongs to the sub-categories of cs.IT and cs.LG, respectively.
